messages.message: The search in the old docs website would show you all the possible matches so that was easier to discern which article you wanted to go to, and now it forces you to pick an article before you see the surrounding text around your search term, which makes it harder for me personally.

For me as well, Jessica! I am interested in making our search better. I don't know how to do it, but moving our docs to be publicly available will provide a more robust platform for findability and search. Yesterday, I replied to @Jonathan Shih above.

> the search feature is not optimal. Yesterday, I filed CD-158 make Instabase documentation public (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/CD-158) to raise visibility to this mission. Public docs will offer best search and SEO.
It looks like hugo has some options regarding search. I haven't looked into this much at all, but it seems like switching to `hugo-elasticsearch` might do better? https://gohugo.io/tools/search/
@Erick yes! I'm open to being led. How can we make this happen? (translate = I will need help, and probably hands on type of help!)

Quickly dug into this. Looks like we're using the `hugo-theme-learn` which implements search using `hugo-lunr` https://github.com/matcornic/hugo-theme-learn/blob/master/static/js/search.js

Might be non-trivial to swap out the algorithm because it'll force us to generate the index differently as well.

I'm open to changes and using another theme... I did only one overwrite for the learn theme in https://github.com/instabase/instabase-docs/pull/48

I know @hollenscary overcame the initial doc structure challenges before my time.
@Erick I'm on a quest to make our docs public... and search becomes even more important.
If we make them public, there might be a way to just have google index it for us and do a site-specific search within :joy:
NOW that's where I want to go @Erick!!
not sure if we’d want to make them public (most of our competitors don’t — it’s a lot of details about our product out there for folks to use as competitive research)
haha agreed with @Chetan on this, I don’t think we should be making this public. What are the benefits of having public docs? Also @Erick how hard is it to index instabase?
Haha yeah I agree as well. It's probably not too bad. Would just need a few hours of engineering time :blush:
@will any chance you helped set up the theme and have any context on how to try out some different searches? :mag_right:

I did! I think someone already posted, but you can replace the search implementation relatively easily. The recommended default is much better, but requires either a public docset or a licensing fee. The search we went with was primarily around ease of adoption and checked the minimum for searchability.
Hahaha oh yeah, the someone earlier in the thread was you, @Erick :stuck_out_tongue:
We should just pay the $ - search is super valuable.
yes please, AND make the docs public.
@Chetan sounds like you are up for improving our UX, I'll make a Jira... what project?
Maybe we can compromise and make teaser public docs xD
API docs are key, devs should not have to authenticate to our platform using a web browser
It can be like documentation for “extract_all_info” :wink:
I think if they don’t want to log in to our system to browse the api docs, we should be thinking more along the lines of making a downloadable set of docs as well, so they only have to log in once
Downloadable is sketchy, since it will be out of date each release.
I like this conversation @Jonathan Shih and @Chetan!!

Docs at my former employer DataStax Docs landing page (https://docs.datastax.com/en/landing_page/doc/landing_page/current.html)
API docs were autogenerated from code and automagically showed here (https://docs.datastax.com/en/landing_page/doc/landing_page/apiDocs.html). We had 1.5 dedicated doc infrastructure team members
Stripe API Reference is what I aspire to! https://stripe.com/docs/api

yea not sure if they should be public lol. either way that decision is likely above our pay grade — should likely check with higher powers. higher powers won’t care about the $ though, so we should definitely integrate the improved search mechanism that @Erick or @will suggested earlier.
@Chetan what project can I create a Jira in? Hmmm wondering, I want to create a ticket and give it some life and assign to you and Shih. :slightly_smiling_face:
yea i think platform eng should handle this given it’s platform docs :slightly_smiling_face: as to who i am not sure
